robot

Class RobotCom<T extends java.nio.channels.ByteChannel>

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot.RobotCom<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of channel this robot com uses.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NetworkRobotCom, SerialRobotCom

    public abstract class RobotCom<T extends java.nio.channels.ByteChannel>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a connection to an Arduino.
    Author:
    Jacob Glueck

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RobotCom(RobotInfo ri)
      Makes a new RobotCom with the specified robot information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobotCom

        public RobotCom(RobotInfo ri)
        Makes a new RobotCom with the specified robot information.
        Parameters:
        ri - the robot information.

    • Method Detail

      • getChannel

        public abstract T getChannel()
        Gets the channel associated with this RobotCom.
        Returns:
        the channel used to communicate with the robot.

      • getRobotInfo

        public RobotInfo getRobotInfo()
        Gets the information of the connected robot.
        Returns:
        the connected robot's information.

      • startInitialization

        public abstract void startInitialization()
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the processes of connecting to the robot.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error with the connection process.

      • waitForInitialization

        public abstract boolean waitForInitialization()
                                       throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for the initialization process to end.
        Returns:
        true if the robot was initialized successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the initialization process was interrupted.

      • isInitialized

        public abstract boolean isInitialized()
        Determines the current initialization state.
        Returns:
        true if the robot is currently connected, false otherwise.

      • getLocationString

        public abstract java.lang.String getLocationString()
        Returns the location to which the ArduinoCom is connected. For example, if it is connected through a serial port, this method might return "COM3" or if it is connected through a network, the IP address.
        Returns:
        A string describing what the ArduinoCom is connected to.

      • disconnect

        public abstract void disconnect()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Disconnects the Arduino by closing the underlying I/O pipes and sockets.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if their is a problem disconnecting.

      • readByte

        public int readByte(int timeout)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException
        Attempts to read a byte within the timeout. If no byte is read, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum amount of time to wait for a byte, in ms.
        Returns:
        the byte read of Integer.MAX_VALUE if no byte was read withing the timeout.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading the byte.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if this method's waiting was interrupted.

      • readWord

        public java.lang.String readWord(int timeout,
                        int maxLength,
                        int maxLeadingWhitespace)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads a word (a sequence of non-whitespace characters surrounded by whitespace) from the robot.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum amount of time to wait for each byte of the word.
        maxLength - the maximum length of the word.
        maxLeadingWhitespace - the maximum of amount of leading whitespace to read.
        Returns:
        the word read or #null if no word was read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an IO while executing the command.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the command execution is interrupted.

      • readPrep

        public abstract void readPrep()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Prepares the channel for reading by putting it into non-blocking mode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was an error.

      • writePrep

        public abstract void writePrep()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Prepares the channel for writing by putting it into blocking mode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was an error.

      • write

        public int write(java.lang.String str)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the specified string.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to write
        Returns:
        the number of characters written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs.
